headline: Critics of Bail Reform Point to the Case of a Serial Bank Robber
abstract: A man accused of robbing banks in New York City had been released under a Jan. 1 law that ended bail for most nonviolent charges.
lead_paragraph: A man walked into a Chase Bank in Brooklyn wearing a Chicago Bulls baseball cap just as the 9-to-5 crowd was leaving work on a recent Friday. He passed a note written in red ink to a teller. “This is a robbery,” it read. “Big bills only no dye packs.”
